member.summary: Lineary interpolates across a 2D plane to return an interpolated third dimensional value. Expected to be used for table interpolation, where x-axis are the columns, and y-axis are the rows.
member.param: The point in the plane to get the corresponding magnitude of.
Point ii (closest to the origin), where is the corresponding value.
Point jj (farthest from the origin), where property is the corresponding value.
The value at point ii, which is closest to the origin.
The value at point ij, which is in line with point ii but farthest along the x-axis (columns).
The value at point ji, which is in line with point ii but farthest along the y-axis (rows).
The value at point jj, which is farthest from the origin.
The tolerance used for determining if a weight lies within the boundaries of the values being interpolated.
member.exception: Different columns must be chosen: Column ii = Column jj = {ii.X}
Different rows must be chosen: Row ii = Row jj = {ii.Y}
Point ({Po.X}, {Po.Y}) must lie within the bounds of values to interpolate within, ({ii.X}, {ii.Y}), ({jj.X}, {jj.Y})
Different columns must be chosen: Column ii = Column jj = {ii.X}
